page.title: 16CHURCHES OF EAST WITTERING
page.content: The first church in East Wittering was built in the twelth century by the Normans.There is a fine Norman door arch.Inside the church there is random rubble walling where the Victorians pulled the plaster off.The windows are more modern now but you can still see the Norman arches where the old small windows were.The church is quite small and can only seat sixty-four people. The church is no longer used because it is not safe but people are still buried in the graveyard.St.Anne's Church was built 27 years ago.It is much bigger than the old church and can hold two hundred people.It is very light and airy.There are some plain windows high up and coloured glass windows lower down.People from the church help in the community by visiting old people and helping them with their shopping and other things.
